result.execSummary:
The defendant Dan J Spitzbardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 1 day sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Domestic Violence or Anger Management Couseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No violent contact with the victims (T. S. and L. C.).
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dan J Spitzbardt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dan J Spitzbardt in court.

Court addressed the defendants right to an attorney and waiver.
Court accepts the defendant waiver of attorney.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guity of ount 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.
Victim (T.S.) presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
45 Days in the waukesha county jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
1 Day Credit - IF REVOKED.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Domestic Violence or Anger Management Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violent contact with:  victims (T.S. & L.C.) listed in the criminal complaint
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dan J Spitzbardt in court.  

Defendant needs to contact ADA Woller directly to get an offer.
Court directs the DA Office to provide the defendant with an offer prior to the next court date.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
